header.title: ResourceExistsSelector in Cocoon
header.abstract: This document describes the ResourceExistsSelector of Cocoon.

tr.td: The ResourceExistsSelector component is used to select appropriate sitemap processing depending on the existence of a set of resources.

s1.title: Description
s1.p: The ResourceExistsSelector selects the first of a set of Resources (usually files) that exists in the context.

s1.title: Usage
s1.p: Pipelines can be built based on the existence of files, for example building a PDF from XSL-FO or a higher-level XML format.

s2.title: Sitemap pipeline examples
s2.source: <map:match pattern="**.html"> <map:select type="resource-exists"> <map:when test="content/{1}.xml"> <map:generate src="content/{1}.xml" /> <map:transform src="stylesheets/page2html.xsl" /> </map:when> <map:otherwise> <map:generate src="resources/html/{1}.html" /> </map:otherwise> </map:select> <map:serialize type="html"/> </map:match>

s2.title: Configuration
s2.p: The optional prefix parameter is prepended to all test expressions before evaluation. The default prefix is '/', meaning that all expressions are relative to the context root, unless explicitly overridden.

s2.title: Setup
s2.p: Setting up a ResourceExistsSelector includes choosing the <map:when> test expressions, and an optional <map:otherwise> clause.

s1.title: See also
s1.p: A general documentation about selectors is available at Matchers and Selectors.
